website_summaries.verdict: Intel's Core i7-4790K is the high-end Haswell-based processor for enthusiasts who liked last year's 4770K CPU, but weren't satisfied with its modest performance improvements.
pros: Adds features that its predecessor lacked
cons: Despite Intel's promises, overclocking headroom is very limited

customer_reviews.title: Insanely fast!
customer_reviews.text: Still insanely fast after two years. I’m running an Oculus Rift VR headset, and coupled with a GTX 1070 OC, this chip still nails it. Just no need to upgrade. Incredible value for money. Just don’t use a stock cooler, this runs hot. I’m using a cooler master EVO to keep this sucker from catching fire!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Antony Mcminn

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, Outdated and still the best.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a good couple of years. Still the single threaded king. Still works perfectly. Got a power virus a few months ago and hit 100'c and hasn't died. To be honest I'm sure you know why you want this if you're here. I'll admit it runs hot, and can reach fairly high temperatures during heavy use (And chews through electricity like an AMD chip) When it was released, Intel released a semi-official statement saying that anybody could overclock this to 5 GHz given adequate cooling. Not sure what cooling they meant, but it's a damn good processor.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Excellent CPU, better suited options available
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent CPU and mine overclocks a massive amount (4.8GHz). Perfect for people video editing or with top end graphics cards, but can fall a little short on multiple GPU setups. Apart from that though there really is no knocking this product. One major piece of advice though is that if you don't plan on overclocking, you can buy a Xeon E3-1231 v3. This is the EXACT same processor just with no overclocking or on board graphics (you'll need a graphics card). It can be found for £80 cheaper as it does not carry the i7 badge, but performs the same and is the same inside. It is also rated for 24/7 usage and higher reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D

customer_reviews.title: Still a Great CPU
customer_reviews.text: Have had this installed now for for 18 months plus , still very pleased with performance, using with Asus Maximus VII Motherboard, GTX780 Graphics, and combination of Samsung and Sandisk SSDs, My only slight concern is the Temperatures it produces under load, idle at 40c is fine but loaded it can get to 86c with Video work, I am just about to go down the Liquid Cooling Route with a Fractal Kelvin S23 to match my Fractal r5 Case, will update the results when i have fitted. Update The Fractal liquid cooler was Very Poor Quality so returned it , Changed the Thermal paste and temps are much more stable now
customer_reviews.author: Jonboy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing much to say, it's just a great CPU and handles everything I throw at it. Just make sure to replace the stock cooler with a better one if you want to run it at 4.4ghz, this chip runs hot with the stock cooler during stress tests. The stock cooler fan is quite loud and irritating too. Google this: 'Intel® Extreme Tuning Utility (Intel® XTU)' and use this program for stress testing. I found that prime95 wasn't optimised for the I7 4790k and gave me very high readings even with my upgraded cooler. I used a CoolerMaster Hyper 212 EVO and it works perfectly with this CPU!
customer_reviews.author: Sean E

customer_reviews.title: holy balls!
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I never really thought changing from a i7 3770k to a i7 4790k would be that big of a deal but even comparing this to the i7 3770k overclocked to 4.2GHz this still beat it and with this CPU being at this speed for this price it should be a good contenter for anyone wanting to overclock or anyone wanting to upgrade but not wanting to have to pay out for ddr4 on top of a new motherboard and CPU. If you already have a 1150 motherboard this could be a great upgrade at a fairly good cost.
customer_reviews.author: Pesk

customer_reviews.title: this CPU is excellent. powerful for gaming as well as other intensive
customer_reviews.text: I have been building computer since 95. I only use Intel, this CPU is excellent. powerful for gaming as well as other intensive, demanding software. My Advice, Do not use the stock cooler!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good speed.
customer_reviews.text: Still working a year on. I am extremely impressed with this when encoding 4k video. Even though this CPU is a few years old, it lets me encode files at an above par speed. I have done a bit of overclocking but I don't see the need as it turbo boosts itself when it needs to. I usually reach 4.16GHz as standard under 100% load.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Guru

customer_reviews.title: the stock cooler mayaswell be binned it was hiiting 86c while playing dirty bomb on min graphics
customer_reviews.text: Decent chip, the stock cooler mayaswell be binned it was hiiting 86c while playing dirty bomb on min graphics, i miss the day when you got a tube of thermal paste with your chip instead ill have to go out and buy one, but when my water cooler arrives today (fingers crossed). Chip performance and speed is fantastic, for the price it truley is amazing, the cores all work to withing 1-3 degrees of each other. great improvement over my i5-2500k
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Cokeley

customer_reviews.title: Good cpu
customer_reviews.text: Was cheap enough at the time and although it’s now on the older side the only issue I find is I can’t over lock anymore due to heat issues, great value cpu and can’t go wrong buying one
customer_reviews.author: Adam J.

customer_reviews.title: I still have this CPU and is running smoothly
customer_reviews.text: After this time I still have this CPU and is running smoothly, good quality and performance. With water cooling I am able to over clock that unit without risk.
customer_reviews.author: Dominik Wazny

customer_reviews.title: Quick Review
customer_reviews.text: It's fast, I like Used to replace my AMD system. It runs all modern games no issues and is great for rendering in programs like Vegas, Blender and Maya (Still recommend a GPU). It runs at a very respectable temperature of 32 under load with a water cooler and all in all I love it... Worth it if you have the money, AMD still has the best Price to Pound.
customer_reviews.author: Tacsweb

customer_reviews.title: Simply glorious
customer_reviews.text: Glorious CPU The more money you can throw at a cpu the better in the world of quad cores at least. If you're looking at this you're probably aiming for high-end gaming, and it will not disappoint. The 1st core performance is superb, so if you can afford to get this over an AMD doorstop, then do it. Water cool it, overclock the balls off it, bask in its glory.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: *drools* this is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Quad Core, each with 2 threads giving you a total of 8 threads or virtual cores, overclockable safely running well at 5Ghz @ about 48C Is she fast?? Oh frak yes, I've never used a cpu this powerful before and OMFG! Boot time with a Samsung EVO SSD was like 6 Secs from on to psw screen, takes me longer to enter my psw than it takes to boot. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Khal

customer_reviews.title: Absolute beast, I'm very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Where to start...first of all, this CPU handles EVERY game with ease while being only 30-40% utilized. This causes my fans to not require to spin much so they're really silent. I overlocked it easily to 4.5Ghz @ only 1.119v. My PC runs like a dream, smooth and very fast. I recommend this to anyone, whether you're only going to be gaming or you will do rendering too!
customer_reviews.author: Andreas Patsalos

customer_reviews.title: BUY NOW
customer_reviews.text: Always being a cheap-ish person I had always stuck with AMD. After buying this it all changed. this CPU is immensely powerful and I haven't got it above 50% without using stress-test, Over-Clocking is why people buy this CPU. if you don't intend to overclock buy the 4790. Temps are very high with stock cooler and fan but that's stock. Get a new Fan like the H80i and you have yourself a 4.7Ghz+ cpu (relying you overclock)
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Best Intel CPU I've Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this CPU for two years now. Does everything I could ever ask for. Not even had to overclock it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Intel I7 4790k Processor
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Intel for many years and it is fast. Having recently upgraded my AMD Phenominem 955 from Win 8 to 8.1 which took me all day, I installed the same on the new system in a quarter of the time. I have not used the over locking as I prefer to see its original potential first. Delivery took over a week from ordering but caused no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Riverman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Fitted with ease with my MSI Z97M motherboard and works well with my liquid cooling. It also overclocked it to 4.4Ghz automatically Upgraded from 3.2 Ghz i7, the extra 1Ghz + is a small, noticeable difference. Great for gaming! Pictures of my build below!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Great processor
customer_reviews.text: Great processor, it even out competed some Skylake and Kaby lake processors.
customer_reviews.author: Haroon Yousuf

customer_reviews.title: Great product and service
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with product as has made an significant increase in performance in my rig and had particular questions about said product answered promptly and clearly, especially to someone like myself who is still learning about pc tech. Slight delay in delivery but only a issue with post office and not the seller and came with neccasary parts for simple enough installation (self taught from YouTube vid) :) .
customer_reviews.author: David Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant CPU
customer_reviews.text: Well what an upgrade from an i5. This is phenomenal, it nearly breaks into a sweat with multiple tasking, glitchy operations and FPS are a thing of the past. Love it, why didn't I upgrade to i7 earlier. This CPU is by far one of the best of the bunch, don't hesitate to buy, you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Horton

customer_reviews.title: Cant be beaten in terms of single core performance (Other ...
customer_reviews.text: Cant be beaten in terms of single core performance (Other than the more pricey Skylake) and my PC runs amazingly fast I dont know what else to say, if you have the budget buy this since Skylake is going to be at least 20% more in terms of RAM, MOBO and CPU which can add up fast
customer_reviews.author: ELAINE E.

customer_reviews.title: stunningly capable
customer_reviews.text: Ruthlessly powerful. I run everything i can think of it and it barely wakes up. It DEVOURS HD video encoding OMG, and my previous computer wasn't exactly ancient...It's really really something It will run 4.7 with little fettling and sensible temps with a half decent air cooler
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Good Performance
customer_reviews.text: I chose this CPU for it's price to performance ratio. Whilst many recommend a generation 5 i5 processor for a gaming rig I felt it was worth investing the i7 as I don't game 24/7 and my PC needed for many things not just super sexy graphics. Also replacing a CPU for a better one down the line does not sound like fun!
customer_reviews.author: Kirsty

customer_reviews.title: Dank
customer_reviews.text: So... I upgraded from an i5 3570k and the difference is dramatic. Gta 5 takes seconds to load compared to the i5, my game runs a lot smoother than it used to, and always stays on 60fps no matter what is going on in the game. I run it with an msi gaming 5 board, 16gb corsair dominator, gaming 4g gtx 970 and a widescreen lg monitor which the resolution is higher than 1920x1080. Overall, if you're thinking about buying it then do it.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: a monster compaired to the I5 4670k
customer_reviews.text: if your wondering to go for the I5 ort his one go for this.the extra money is worth it.it increses your RAM capabilities.idk how but it put an extra point on my windows score for the ram.i actually own an I% 4670k as well and this is a monster in compearison.

customer_reviews.title: ... ago and I still cant get over what an amazing piece of technology this is
customer_reviews.text: I bought this processor 12 months ago and I still cant get over what an amazing piece of technology this is ... its lightning fast

customer_reviews.title: All good
customer_reviews.text: Had mostly bought this for gaming and so far seems to be running well, and is very fast. Would recommend getting an aftermarket cooler as it can run hot with the stock cooler. Haven't yet tried over clocking, will be getting a new cooler first.

customer_reviews.text: very impressed using a nocta NH-D15 idle temps around 26 under full load around 58 degree. unbelievable improvement in arma 3 which run horrible on my i5 only gripe you will def have to buy a cooler as the supplied one is a joke for this cpu

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This product is fit for purpose and worth the money spent. I have no complaints and would recommed this to anyone.

customer_reviews.title: An i5 4690K would have suited my needs but they ...
customer_reviews.text: An i5 4690K would have suited my needs but they were out of stock so I paid extra to get this. Performance wise for gaming it isnt going to make much difference for me over the i5 but in terms of the gaming - this chip it perfectly suited.

customer_reviews.title: Great processor. After reading several reviews about the Intel ...
customer_reviews.text: Great processor. After reading several reviews about the Intel Core i7 4790K I knew that I had to use a different cooler than the one supplied by Intel. I've had no need to over-clock yet and stock speeds up to now are more than impressive.

customer_reviews.title: Good performance, overheats often.
customer_reviews.text: Good performance. Had to replace it once already due to overheating issues (looked after properly) after only a year. The replacement is also overheating already, making me question how well they're made.

customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my P.C. from I 3 to I 7. It is a fantastic improvement

customer_reviews.text: An absolute monster of a processor, this was a huge upgrade for us with our new build system. I've never seen the pc as of yet ( few months down the line) slow down, this handles everything with timely precision. Definitely recommend.

customer_reviews.title: however this mother F***** can run pretty much any game I throw at it on high ...

customer_reviews.text: Does what it says! Minor problem: the box arrived with a seal broken and the box has been opened before I received it. However the CPU was still intact and untouched.

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully Performing Processor
customer_reviews.text: This is a great processor. I have been using it for some time now and I can say I didn't think it would be this good. I had to use it without a graphics card for 2 days and I have to say I was really impressed with the integrated graphics. The integrated graphics can run CS:GO and Skyrim perfectly from experience, and with a GTX 970 I can max almost all of my games at 1080p 60fps

customer_reviews.title: Just running my fsx as sweet as a nut

customer_reviews.title: Cannot stress how good this CPU is
customer_reviews.text: Cannot stress how good this CPU is. Easily overclockable, but why would you even want to bother, it's an absolute dream right out of the box, and I will be using this for years to come

customer_reviews.title: Awakening the devil
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time, works great. The temperature of this cpu can hit around 60/70 degrees even with water cooling at times when loading high spec games, but even so it has yet to show any other signs of consern. It's very fast, and has not shown any problems thus far.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for money as always with Intel cpu's. Cost much more than amd chips but work much, much better and run cooler as well. Overclocked mine at 4.7GHz and can handle everything I have thrown at it with temperatures of about 60 degrees. Cooled by a Antec H1200 cooler.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and quick review, I got this to replace ...
customer_reviews.text: Simple and quick review, I got this to replace a i7 920 and its an incredible change, the performance of my rig has shot up. I use it in combination with a 670GTX and I wasn't sure but now I know the 920 was causing a lot of bottlenecks. I was getting 12 FPS in Battlefield 4 and now I'm getting 60 - 90. Well worth it.

customer_reviews.title: Gaming 2015/16, this is the cpu you want.....
customer_reviews.text: Great cpu for gamers. Don't hesitate. If you're on a budget, go for the unlocked i5 4960K, around £100 cheaper. Both can be overclocked but I have never felt to need to, though it's nice I can in the future.
